column17: The pilot’s failure to maintain clearance from the water while maneuvering at low altitude.
The pilot’s failure to attain a proper touchdown point, resulting in a runway excursion.

The pilot’s improper decision to reject the takeoff at an excessive speed, resulting in a runway excursion and collision with a fence. Contributing to the accident was the pilot’s failure to lock the door as required by the placarded door closing procedures.
The pilot’s failure to conduct a proper preflight inspection and ensure the fuel was uncontaminated, which resulted in a partial loss of engine power and forced landing.
A hard landing and subsequent loss of control.
The pilot’s failure to use carburetor heat on approach in weather conditions conducive to carburetor icing, which resulted in a forced landing to a pond.
